author: Frida Tochimani
title: ¡Toma precauciones! Conagua advierte heladas y lluvias en México HOY viernes 13 de diciembre
text:
Ciudad de México.- ¿Este viernes 13 de diciembre del 2024 tienes planeado realizar actividades al aire libre en México? Si la respuesta es afirmativa, ya sea por motivos académicos, laborales o recreativos, es indispensable que [consultes](https://smn.conagua.gob.mx/es/pronosticos/pronosticossubmenu/pronostico-meteorologico-general) el pronóstico del clima y el tiempo que advierten el Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN) y la Comisión Nacional del Agua (Conagua clima). ¡Abrígate! Pues continuarán las heladas en el país.
Conagua advierte heladas en México HOY viernes 13 de diciembre
El SMN y la Conagua Clima señalan que este viernes 13 de diciembre del 224 una circulación anticiclónica en niveles medios de la atmósfera se establecerá sobre el centro y occidente de México. Este fenómeno ocasionará un ascenso gradual de las temperaturas vespertinas y baja probabilidad de lluvia sobre la mayor parte del territorio nacional.
Te podría interesar
No obstante, se mantendrá el ambiente frío a muy frío durante la mañana y noche de este viernes, con posibles heladas en zonas altas de la Mesa del Norte y la Mesa Central, además de bancos de niebla en la Sierra Madre Occidental, la Sierra Madre Oriental, el Valle de México y las sierras de Baja California, Oaxaca y Chiapas, por efecto de la irradiación nocturna. Así quedarán las temperaturas este día:
- Temperaturas mínimas de -10 a -5 °C con heladas en zonas montañosas de Baja California, Sonora, Chihuahua y Durango.
- Mínimas de -5 a 0 °C con heladas en puntos altos de Baja California Sur, Zacatecas, San Luis Potosí, Hidalgo, Estado de México, Tlaxcala y Puebla.
- Temperaturas mínimas de 0 a 5 °C en zonas serranas de Coahuila, Aguascalientes, Jalisco, Michoacán, Guanajuato, Querétaro, Morelos, Ciudad de México, Veracruz y Oaxaca.
Por otra parte, un canal de baja presión sobre el sureste de México, aunado al ingreso de humedad del océano Pacífico, golfo de México y mar Caribe, propiciará lluvias e intervalos de chubascos en dicha región, además de zonas del oriente del territorio nacional y la península de Yucatán. Por último, el SMN y la Conagua informan que las corrientes en chorro polar y subtropical originarán vientos fuertes con posibles tolvaneras en el noroeste y norte de la República Mexicana.
¡Disfruta de tu viernes!
Fuente: Tribuna / Comisión Nacional del Agua (Conagua Clima)

author: September 5
title: Razorbacks Open 2024-25 Season at the Folds of Honor Collegiate
text: Razorbacks Open 2024-25 Season at the Folds of Honor Collegiate FAYETTEVILLE – For the second consecutive year, the Arkansas men’s golf program will open its season by playing in the Folds of Honor Collegiate, played Sept. 9-11 in Grand Haven, Mich., at American Dunes Golf Club. GOLF Channel will broadcast men’s action live each day – Monday: 3:30-6:30 pm (CT), Tuesday: 8:30-11:30 am and Wednesday: 3:30-6:30 pm (CT). The Razorbacks, which placed third at last year’s Folds of Honor Collegiate, is ranked #17 in the preseason coaches poll and will take a fresh lineup to this year’s tournament. Thomas Curry and Matthis Lefevre return from last year’s squad, but the pair did not participate in last year’s event. However, they finished 2023-24 strong. Curry was named to the SEC All-Freshman team and posted the fourth-best season scoring average by a Razorback rookie. Lefevre had a 71.785 scoring average in his six events with four top-20 finishes, including a T-17 result with two match play wins at the 2024 SEC Championship. The other three Razorbacks that qualified for this year’s Folds of Honor Collegiate include freshmen Gerardo Gomez and Erich Fortlage – two players that helped make up the fourth-best recruiting class in the nation – and transfer Mark Stockdale, who was named the ASUN Freshman of the Year last season at UCA. Joining Arkansas in the season opener is #3 Florida State, #8 Texas, #9 Illinois, #16 Alabama, #22 Ohio State, 34 Notre Dame, Air Force, UAPB, Army West Point, Grand Valley State (preseason #7 in NCAA DII), Kansas, Kentucky, Michigan State and Navy. Jack Nicklaus designed the American Dunes Golf Club, the home of the Folds of Honor. Folds of Honor is dedicated to supporting military and first responder families through educational scholarships. A total of 221 Arkansas students have benefitted from the Folds of Honor Collegiate Scholarship Fund which is second-most among the 18 men’s and women’s teams participating this year. Folds of Honor Collegiate Sept. 9-11, 2024 Hosts: GCAA / Michigan State / Florida State American Dunes Golf Club (72) || Grand Haven, Mich. Format: 5-count-4 || 18 holes each day Live TV Coverage on GOLF Channel and Peacock Men’s Field with preseason GCAA ranking: Air Force #16 Alabama #17 Arkansas Arkansas-Pine Bluff Army West Point #3 Florida State #7 DII Grand Valley State #9 Illinois Kansas Kentucky Michigan State Navy #34 Notre Dame #22 Ohio State #8 Texas Razorback Lineup: Thomas Curry Gerardo Gomez Mark Stockdale Matthis Lefevre Erich Fortlage For more information on Arkansas Men’s Golf, [X](https://x.com/RazorbackMGolf) and

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Jersey County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Jersey County, Illinois from 1901-2000 was 32.2. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Jersey County, Illinois experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Jersey County, Illinois history.
